abstract: Yahoo announced a broad deal with publishers representing 264 newspapers to sell national advertising across their Web sites.
snippet: Yahoo announced a broad deal with publishers representing 264 newspapers to sell national advertising across their Web sites.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, April 16  After a flurry of deal making over the last few days, Google and Yahoo, two giants of the online advertising business, are set to encroach on each other’s turf even more aggressively than before.

headline.main: Yahoo Strikes Ad Deal With More Papers
headline.print_headline: Yahoo Strikes Ad Deal With More Papers

abstract: Google‘s $3.1 billion acquisition of online advertising firm DoubleClick drove up shares of other Internet ad firms. What was behind the rise? Many investors were betting that Microsoft (which was reportedly also in the running for DoubleClick) and Yahoo would be driven to make deals of their own to keep up with Google.
lead_paragraph: Google‘s $3.1 billion acquisition of online advertising firm DoubleClick drove up shares of other Internet ad firms. What was behind the rise? Many investors were betting that Microsoft (which was reportedly also in the running for DoubleClick) and Yahoo would be driven to make deals of their own to keep up with Google.

headline.main: DoubleCick Deal Puts Spotlight on Rivals

abstract: Who says venture capitalists have no sense of humor? Well, if anyone was saying it, a recent venture by Sequoia Capital would put the kibosh on that notion. The investment firm which has backed YouTube, Google, Yahoo, Oracle and Apple, among others, has partnered up up with funny man Will Ferrell and writer-director-producer Adam Mckay to launch FunnyOrDie.com, a comedy video site that began its beta release Thursday.
lead_paragraph: Who says venture capitalists have no sense of humor? Well, if anyone was saying it, a recent venture by Sequoia Capital would put the kibosh on that notion. The investment firm which has backed YouTube, Google, Yahoo, Oracle and Apple, among others, has partnered up up with funny man Will Ferrell and writer-director-producer Adam Mckay to launch FunnyOrDie.com, a comedy video site that began its beta release Thursday.

headline.main: Sequoia Gets Its Kicks With Will Ferrell Web Site

abstract: Hellman & Friedman is having a busy week. Just a few days ago, the San Francisco private equity firm agreed to sell portfolio company DoubleClick to Google for $3.1 billion, well above the $1.1 billion that Hellman and JMI Equity paid for the advertising firm just two years ago. On Tuesday, Hellman & Friedman announced that it raised $8.4 billion for its latest private equity fund, giving it plenty of ammunition for more deals. The new fund, which is the firm’s sixth, represents more than half of the $16 billion that Hellman & Friedman has raised since 1987.
lead_paragraph: Hellman & Friedman is having a busy week. Just a few days ago, the San Francisco private equity firm agreed to sell portfolio company DoubleClick to Google for $3.1 billion, well above the $1.1 billion that Hellman and JMI Equity paid for the advertising firm just two years ago. On Tuesday, Hellman & Friedman announced that it raised $8.4 billion for its latest private equity fund, giving it plenty of ammunition for more deals. The new fund, which is the firm’s sixth, represents more than half of the $16 billion that Hellman & Friedman has raised since 1987.

headline.main: Hellman & Friedman Raises $8.4 Billion Buyout Fund
